free_text.Contenu: [li]Discrete, Hierarchical and Bayesian Classifiers: K-means, soft K-means, Mixture of Gaussians, EM-[br/][li]Statistical Decomposition of Signals: PCA, ICA[br/][li]Non-linear Regression: Support Vector Regression, Gaussian Mixture Regression[br/][li]Artificial Neural Networks and Genetic Algorithms[br/][li]Markov-Based Techniques for Time Series Analysis: Hidden Markov Models, Reinforcement Learning
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Controlling complex systems (e.g. controlling high-degrees of freedom autonomous robots, analyzing multimodal signals) requires methods to deal with a large dataset of dynamic variables, which cannot be well approximated by classical or deterministic models. This course will give an overview of a number of alternative methods from Machine Learning that have been proven successful for the analysis of non-linear, highly noisy and correlated data. Students will familiarize themselves with each method through short hands-on practical. The course will be evaluated through a final exam (50% grade) and through the reports following each practical (50% grade).[br/]
